lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: What's the reason for your visit today?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: I've developed this rash on my arms and torso about a week ago and it's really itchy and spreading.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Where did it start?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: My forearms, then spread to chest and stomach. Red raised bumps everywhere.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Any new medications, soaps, or foods recently?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: I started amoxicillin about 10 days ago for a urinary tract infection.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Have you ever had a medication reaction before?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: No, this is the first time.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Any difficulty breathing or swelling of face or throat?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: No, just the rash and itching.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: How bad is the itching?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: Really bad especially at night. I'm scratching so much some spots are bleeding.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Have you tried anything for it?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: Hydrocortisone cream and Benadryl. Benadryl helps me sleep but the cream doesn't do much.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Any fever or joint pain?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: Low fever around 99 degrees and my joints have been achy.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Any known allergies?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: Just seasonal allergies to ragweed. No drug allergies that I know of.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: I'd like to stop the amoxicillin and switch antibiotics.

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: Will the rash go away once I stop the medication?
